title: Understanding Functional Analysis
text: Functional analysis is a method used to understand the reasons behind a behavior. It involves identifying the triggers and consequences of the behavior to develop strategies to prevent it from recurring.

hintAnswer: strategy for preventing a recurring problematic behavior by first identifying why a behavior keeps recurring and then devising a plan to prevent recurrences
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes functional analysis?
choices: behavioral condition in which the child has symptoms of being uncooperative, defiant, and may be hostile toward people in authority
children experience chronic, intense, angry outbursts
strategy for preventing a recurring problematic behavior by first identifying why a behavior keeps recurring and then devising a plan to prevent recurrences
